title: Treatment of Bleeding Disorders
subject: Pharmacology
description: Questions about the treatment of bleeding disorders based on provided material.

questions.questionText: Based what you have been taught, what are coagulants indicated for?
questions.explanation: Coagulants are substances which promote coagulation, and are indicated in hemorrhagic states.

questions.questionText: Fresh whole blood or plasma provides which components needed for coagulation?
questions.explanation: Fresh whole blood or plasma provide all the factors needed for coagulation.

questions.questionText: What is considered the best therapy for deficiency of any clotting factor?
questions.explanation: Fresh whole blood or plasma is described as the best therapy for deficiency of any clotting factor.

questions.questionText: Regarding the action of fresh whole blood or plasma, they act:
questions.explanation: Fresh whole blood or plasma are stated to act immediately.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is listed as a physical method for local hemostasis?
questions.explanation: Physical methods for local hemostasis include application of pressure, cold or cautery .

questions.questionText: An example of a vasoconstrictor used locally for hemostasis, according to the handouts, is:
questions.explanation: Vasoconstrictors e.g. adrenaline locally are listed under local hemostatics .

questions.questionText: How do astringents like tannic acid and alum act to control bleeding locally?
options: By precipitating blood proteins at the site of bleeding
questions.correctAnswer: By precipitating blood proteins at the site of bleeding
questions.explanation: Astringents e.g. tannic acid and alum, act by precipitation of blood proteins at the site of bleeding .

questions.questionText: Local coagulants are agents applied locally to control bleeding from which size of vessels?
questions.explanation: Local coagulants are defined as Agents applied locally to control bleeding from minute vessels .

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT listed as a local coagulant in the handout?
questions.explanation: Thrombin powder, Fibrin glues, and Gel foam are listed as local coagulants . Desmopressin acetate is listed as a systemic hemostatic .

questions.questionText: Microfibrillar collagen is listed as a local coagulant with a potential side effect of:
options: Severe pain at the application site
questions.explanation: Microfibrillar collagen is non-allergenic but can promote local infection and abscess formation .

questions.questionText: Vitamin K is classified as which type of hemostatic ?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K is listed under Systemic hemostatics (coagulants) .

questions.questionText: What type of substance is Vitamin K?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K is a fat-soluble substance .

questions.questionText: The Handout mentions how many natural sources and how many synthetic forms of Vitamin K?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K sources are described as having 2 natural sources and 1 synthetic form . These are Vitamin K1, Vitamin K2, and synthetic menadione (Vitamin K3) .

questions.questionText: Vitamin K1 is primarily found in which type of food?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K1 is found primarily in leafy green vegetables .

questions.questionText: Vitamin K2 is additionally synthesized by:
options: Bacteria that colonize the human intestine
questions.correctAnswer: Bacteria that colonize the human intestine
questions.explanation: Vitamin K2 is additionally synthesized by the bacteria that colonize the human intestine .

questions.questionText: What is the synthetic form of Vitamin K mentioned, and what is required for it to be active?
options: Menadione (Vitamin K3); needs conversion to menaquinone-4
questions.correctAnswer: Menadione (Vitamin K3); needs conversion to menaquinone-4
questions.explanation: The synthetic menadione (vitamin K3) is a provitamin that needs to be converted to menaquinone-4 to be active .

questions.questionText: Vitamin K acts as an essential cofactor for the carboxylation of which amino acid residues in many vitamin K-dependent proteins?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K is the essential cofactor for the carboxylation of glutamic acid residues in many vitamin K-dependent proteins .

questions.questionText: Vitamin K-dependent proteins are involved in which of the following processes ?
options: Blood coagulation, bone metabolism, and prevention of vessel mineralization
questions.correctAnswer: Blood coagulation, bone metabolism, and prevention of vessel mineralization
questions.explanation: Vitamin K-dependent proteins (VKDPs) that are involved in blood coagulation, bone metabolism, prevention of vessel mineralization, and regulation of various cellular functions .

questions.questionText: Vitamin K is used to stop bleeding problems due to which of the following?
options: Hemorrhagic disease of vitamin K deficiency
questions.correctAnswer: Hemorrhagic disease of vitamin K deficiency
questions.explanation: Vitamin K is used to stop bleeding problems due to oral anticoagulants and bleeding due to hypoprothrobinemia resulting from decreased synthesis, hepatic utilization, absorption, or large dose aspirin . Hemorrhagic disease of vitamin K deficiency in newborns is also mentioned .

questions.questionText: Hypoprothrombinemia resulting from decreased synthesis of Vitamin K by intestinal flora can be caused by:
options: Oral broad spectrum antibiotics e.g. cefoperazone
questions.correctAnswer: Oral broad spectrum antibiotics e.g. cefoperazone
questions.explanation: Decreased Synthesis of vit. K by intestinal flora can be caused by oral broad spectrum antibiotics e.g. cefoperazone, leading to hypoprothrombinemia .

questions.questionText: Decreased Hepatic utilization of Vitamin K leading to hypoprothrombinemia can be associated with:
questions.explanation: Decreased Hepatic utilization of vit. K as liver disease and newborn is listed as a cause of hypoprothrombinemia treatable by Vitamin K .

questions.questionText: Decreased Absorption of Vitamin K resulting in hypoprothrombinemia can occur with:
questions.explanation: Decreased Absorption of vit. K as with liquid paraffin, malabsorption syndrome is listed as a cause of hypoprothrombinemia treatable by Vitamin K .

questions.questionText: Ingestion of a large dose of which common analgesic can contribute to hypoprothrombinemia treatable by Vitamin K?
questions.explanation: Aspirin large dose is listed as a cause of hypoprothrombinemia treatable by Vitamin K .

questions.questionText: What forms of Vitamin K1 are available clinically?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K1 is available clinically in oral forms and parenteral forms .

questions.questionText: Vitamin K1 is currently administered routinely to which population to prevent hemorrhagic disease of vitamin K deficiency?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K1 is currently administered to all newborns to prevent the hemorrhagic disease of vitamin K deficiency .

questions.questionText: Protamine sulphate is listed as an antidote for overdose of which anticoagulant?
questions.explanation: Protamine sulphate is listed as antidote to heparin overdose .

questions.questionText: Which of the following are mentioned as examples of antifibrinolytics?
questions.explanation: Antifibrinolytics as Aminocaproic and Tranexamic acid orally are listed .

questions.questionText: Desmopressin acetate, a synthetic derivative of vasopressin, works by releasing which factors from vascular endothelium?
options: Factor VIII and von Willebrand’s factor
questions.correctAnswer: Factor VIII and von Willebrand’s factor
questions.explanation: Desmopressin acetate... releases factor VIII & von Willebrand’s factor from vascular endothelium .

questions.questionText: Based what you have been taught, Idarucizumab is a specific antidote for which anticoagulant?
questions.explanation: Idarucizumab is listed as a specific antidote of dabigatran .

questions.questionText: Andexant alpha is listed as a specific antidote for which anticoagulant?
questions.explanation: Andexant alpha is listed as a specific antidote for rivaroxaban . (Note: While Andexanet alfa is also an antidote for apixaban and edoxaban in clinical practice, the source *only* mentions rivaroxaban for Andexant alpha) .
